column4: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Feb 21 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2045 GMT on Wednesday:

column4: Broadcom cuts Qualcomm offer to $117 billion after new NXP deal
column5: Microchip maker Broadcom Ltd  cut its bid for Qualcomm Inc  on Wednesday by 4 percent to $117 billion as it objected to Qualcomm’s decision to raise its own bid for NXP Semiconductors NV  to $44 billion. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Broadcom cuts Qualcomm offer to $117 bln after new NXP deal
column5: Feb 21 Microchip maker Broadcom Ltd cut its bid for Qualcomm Inc on Wednesday by 4 percent to $117 billion as it objected to Qualcomm’s decision to raise its own bid for NXP Semiconductors NV to $44 billion.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm Issues Statement On Reduced Broadcom Proposal
column5: * QUALCOMM - "BROADCOM'S REDUCED PROPOSAL HAS MADE AN INADEQUATE OFFER EVEN WORSE"

column4: Broadcom cuts Qualcomm bid by $3 per share
column5: Feb 21 Broadcom Corp has lowered its takeover offer for chipmaker Qualcomm Inc to $79 per share from $82 to account for the latter's increased offer for NXP Semiconductors NV  Broadcom said on Wednesday.

column4: Temenos agrees 1.4 billion pounds deal for Fidessa  activist Elliott enters
column5: ZURICH Temenos agreed a 1.4 billion pound ($1.96 billion) takeover of British software peer Fidessa Group on Wednesday  whose shares traded above the offer price after activist investor Elliott Capital Advisors disclosed a stake.

column4: UPDATE 2-Temenos agrees 1.4 bln stg deal for Fidessa  activist Elliott enters
column5: * Elliott Capital Advisors discloses nearly 5 pct Fidessa stake (Updates market reaction  adds details on Elliott)
